Great and Fun game,the reason it's a masterpiece because of the impact it had on the gaming industry especially in fps genre, Great game mechanics and the gameplay is top notch,Good story maybe ahead of it's time. One of the best games I ever played.Great in almost everything!
Rating 9.2/10

Una muestra de que cuando Valve quiere hace maravillas. Uno de los mejores y mas misteriosos lores de los videojuegos.
No quiero decir que se haya dormido en los laureles, pero si le gustan los shooter, debe probar este.

Did you ever hear the Tragedy of Gordon Freeman the wise? I thought not. It's not a story the Combine would tell you. It's a resistance legend. Gordon Freeman was a Dark Lord of the Resistance, so powerful and so wise he could use the Gravity gun to influence the props to create death... He had such a knowledge of Theoretical Physics that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The Theoretical physics of the Gravity gun is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be Theoretical. He became so powerful... the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually, of course, he did. Unfortunately, Gman everything he knew, then Gman killed him in his sleep. It's ironic he could save others from death, but not himself.

This game is really good.  The shooting is a little shallow, but the gameplay is great because of the creativity in the level design.  The overall cinematic feel of the game is unlike any thing else I've played.  The only real nitpick I have is that some of the levels go on a little too long.  But still an unforgettable, unique experience that everyone should play.
Took me about 10hours to beat, i'm a bit slow and mentally challenged but i still had a great time, wasn't bored once playing it, Great story line and just such a great game overall. 10/10
Gordon is a theoretical physicist because for him physics are just theoretical.
This game makes you feel like Gordon Freeman-Pyrocynical

After 16 years and multiple playthroughs, it still is one of the best video games ever made. Just played through it again, and I still enjoy the variety of gameplay offered and the pacing of the story. If you listen to Breen's speeches long enough, you pick up a disturbing line of thought that resonates with today's society. It's eerie how in-touch this game is to modern life.

This game is a masterpiece, especially when played with mmod. Graphics still hold up today. The voice acting is some of the best in a video game ever. Definitely worth the buy.

There is the Mona Lisa in art, there is the Godfather in movies, there is Michelangelos David in sculpturing and there is Half Life 2 in videogames. When someone comes up to you and says that one of those Masterpieces sucks, you should turn around and let them be. There is no point of talking reason into a donkey.

Story's great, combat's tense, and physics is spot-on. Highly recommend for those who are new to Valve games.

This game has a great narrative: 20 years since the resonance cascade, Gordon freeman is woken up to fight against the combine, an intergalactic force, after a 7 hour war... ah who am I kidding, I cant explain, being a great game despite being somewhat old, it introduced a great physics engine, which this engine I like, the easy combat difficulty is best for new players

The best game out there. Definitely worth every penny of your money. Extremely enjoyed the source physics, gravity gun, rag doll body physics and all the little nuances of the game. And the story man!!!!!! the story. Valve did an excellent job with the story. Loved Gordon's characterization and alyxs quirks. Definitely a good, no, great buy.
